drug.drug_name: Procedure: EUS-guided coeliac ganglion neurolysis / celiac plexus neurolysis

long_title: Upfront Endoscopic Ultrasound-guided Celiac Ganglion Neurolysis Versus Conventional Step-up Approach for Patients With Painful, Inoperable Pancreatic Cancer
prior_treatment_requirements: 2. Diagnosed to have inoperable pancreatic cancer
3. Presence of tumor pain (centrally located, constant, with no other obvious cause) with a VAS \>= 3
5. Planned for EUS examination and/or biopsy of the pancreatic tumor
Exclude - 1. Allergy to bupivacaine, or alcohol
Exclude - 2. Potentially operable after neoadjuvant therapy
Exclude - 3. Expected survival of less than 3 months
Exclude - 4. Patient who is already on opioids for pain control
Exclude - 5. Previous percutaneous or EUS-guided CGN/ CPN
Exclude - 6. Recurrent pancreatic tumors after operation
Exclude - 8. Inability or unwillingness to provide informed consent
short_title: Upfront EUS CGN/CPN vs Conventional Step up Approach for Inoperable Painful Pancreatic Cancer
summary: Patients with unresectable pancreatic cancer are often demoralized by intractable, persistent and incapacitating pain. It must be managed aggressively and strong opioids are recommended as the mainstay of treatment. However, patients develop opioid-related adverse effects. EUS-guided celiac plexus neurolysis (CPN) and celiac ganglion neurolysis (CGN) has been shown to provide high efficacy for pain control. The optimal timing, however, is in debate.

arm.arm_code: EUS-guided coeliac ganglion neurolysis / celiac plexus neurolysis
arm.arm_description:
Patient would undergo a EUS diagnostic procedure with or without a biopsy. Patient would be blinded to the group they were assigned. The procedure will be performed with a linear array echoendoscope (EUS) under conscious sedation or monitored anaesthesia care.

For cases in which celiac ganglia could not be visualized, EUS-guided coeliac plexus neurolysis (CPN) will be performed.

dose_level.level_description: Procedure: EUS-guided coeliac ganglion neurolysis / celiac plexus neurolysis

arm.arm_description:
Patient would undergo a EUS diagnostic procedure with or without a biopsy. Patient would be blinded to the group they were assigned. The concept of the conventional step-up approach is to follow ESMO clinical practice guidelines for cancer pain.

In case of inadequate pain control, the analgesics will be stepped up according to the guidelines. After 4 weeks, if patient's VAS score more than 7 or VAS score fails to improve by 20% despite optimal oral analgesics, patients are given the option of EUS-guided CGN/ CPN.
